page.title: 04FARMING AT COTTINGLEY.
page.content: {Farming was of great importance in this area.Corn brought prosperity;poor harvests during several years led to a decline.Today farming is on a small scale.The land is mainly used for grazing;there is a small acreage of arable land growing winter wheat.The farms are family concerns with small numbers of animals;Spring End Farm has eighty three pigs and thirty beef cattle.Little machinery is used. {Near Cottingley estate is Snittles Farm which has been there for over two hundred years.The farm comprises several buildings including an old farm cottage.A variety of animals are to be seen including donkeys, dogs, pigeons,cats,hens,a goose,cows and horses.There is a riding school and the horses are show jumpers.A flock of forty seven sheep graze on the rough pasture around the farm.
